content.full_text: Abraham Lincoln to James K. Polk, 11 December 18471 Some days since Itransmittedto you the application of MrRhoadsofPekin Illinois, for a Lieutenancy– Since then I have received the enclosed letter of Hon:E. D. Baker, in his behalf, which I now take the liberty of submitting to you–2
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to James K. Polk, 11 December 18471

Some days since Itransmittedto you the application of MrRhoadsofPekin Illinois, for a Lieutenancy– Since then I have received the enclosed letter of Hon:E. D. Baker, in his behalf, which I now take the liberty of submitting to you–2

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed the letter.

2The enclosure has not been located. It does not appear that Franklin L. Rhoads received
                  a commission.
